description: Ms. codex. Title supplied by cataloger. 19 lines per page (text 1). From fol. 59 on: 33 to 37 lines. Written in small naskh in black ink with use of red. Marginal notes. Collation statement at the end of each quire (see fol. 20b, 30b, 58a). The quires are numbered in red ink, using Arabic numerals (see fol. 11a, 21a, 31a, 41a, 51a). There are no catchwords. Fol. 1a-2a: inscriptions and ownership statements. Fol. 2a and 72b: impressions of stamps. Fol. 2 consists of two leaves pasted on one another, with inscriptions visible. Worm-eaten ; extremely fragile. Text 1 copied on 11 Muḥarram 890 in the Madrasah al-Daylamīyah in Cairo (fol. 58a). Text 3 copied on 11 Ramaḍān 892 (fol. 69b).
author: ʻAlāʼī, Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad, 1452-1512 or 1513
abstract: Abridgment of Ibn ʻAbd al-Barr's Jamīʻ bayān al-ʻilm wa-faḍlih, on the virtues of science. The ms. contains also selections from two other texts.
contents: 1. fol. 2a-58a: Tuḥfat dhawī al-albāb fī maḥāsin al-adab / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-ʻAlāʼī.
2. fol. 58b: Min inshāʼ kātibihi ... Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-ʻAlāʼī.
3. fol. 59a-b: Faṣl fī mabdaʼ nahr al-Nīl wa-muntahāh [apparently an abstract from al-Qawl al-mufīd fī al-Nīl al-saʻīd by Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Maḥallī, d. 864/1459].
4. fol. 60b-69b: Intiqāʼ Zahr al-rabīʻ / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-ʻAlāʼī.
extent: 73 leaves : paper ; 181 x 134 (119 x 80 and 168 x 128) mm.

binding_note: Upper and lower covers and envelope flap made of brown leather over paper pasteboard. Marbled paper (almost completely faded) pasted on both covers and envelope flap. Yellow paper pastedowns.
